etymology.description: 日 “sun” + 頁 “head; man” — man under the scorching sun; later variants often add 止/夊 “foot” and 𦥑 “two hands.”
etymology.interpretation: Depicts a person beneath a blazing sun, evoking the heat associated with summer. Extra “feet” and “hands” in early forms emphasize a human figure moving or standing under the sun.

examples.chinese: 夏朝是中国的第一个王朝(夏朝是中國的第一個王朝)。
examples.pinyin: Xiàcháo shì Zhōngguó de dì yī gè wángcháo.
examples.english: The Xia dynasty was China’s first dynasty.

examples.chinese: 夏至这天白昼最长(夏至這天白晝最長)。
examples.pinyin: Xiàzhì zhè tiān báizhòu zuì cháng.
examples.english: On the summer solstice, the daylight is the longest.
